summary: This is an email chain from January 11, 2019, regarding setting up a Relativity database for the case 'U.S. v. Epstein' and granting access to Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs). The email discusses uploading initial FBI case file materials and preparing for a large batch of documents expected in the coming weeks.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email requesting the setup of a Relativity database for the Epstein case and access for AUSAs.

events.title: FBI Case File Compilation
events.description: Reference to an FBI case file folder dated December 4, 2018, containing investigation materials, reports, and FOIA documents to be uploaded to the new Relativity database.

keyFacts: The document is a request to set up a Relativity database specifically for the case 'U.S. v. Epstein'.
Access to the database is to be granted to Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs).
Initial documents for upload are from an FBI case file folder dated December 4, 2018, containing investigation materials, reports, and FOIA documents.
The email anticipates receiving a large amount of case files in the coming weeks, indicating an active phase of evidence gathering.
The correspondence highlights the use of a secure, web-based document management system (Relativity with RSA token access) for handling case materials.
